commit_message:
Drop implementation for OS::Magnum::Bay/BayModel

Magnum has deprecated it's Bay API and BayModel API a long ago and
these resource types were deprecated and are hidden in Heat now.

Magnum has removed the old API during Zed cycle and the resources are
no longer supported, so we should remove the implementation now.

Change-Id: If4c6a83a83f9eb29407eb632f47c7229b5492ffd
(cherry picked from commit 87bdbfdcabd3e2310b147b873930009309a6d986)

commit_message:
Bootstrap when running against last backend

When deploying keystone for the first time, aliveness check inside
service_bootstrap can not succeed for multi-node setup, as playbook
will disable current backend. So we need to bootstrap host only
when running against last host in play. We also should make sure, that
following tasks will not fail when running against first ones.

Closes-Bug: #1990008
Related-Bug: #1989326
Change-Id: Ifa9a79c34265b225a5e24c30cae47d3f0fa0739f

commit_message:
Add new line after proxyclient_address

Currently Jinja trim_blocks function does remove newline from end of
proxyclient_address which makes port_range option appearing on the same
line.

Change-Id: If33021bd0453be3ca18753777e82da12f470b278
Closes-Bug: #1988337

commit_message:
Fix application_credential identification in auth

In cases, when a token was created from application_credentials, and
a service tries to auth with such token, method_names would include
application_credential since it's a part of the reciept. At the same
auth supposed to be processed with just a token, so it does not include
assumed properties that application_credential does have which results
in KeyError.

With that we change condition and try to get application_credential.id
only when application_credential is part of the auth instead of the
method_names.

Closes-Bug: #1959674
Change-Id: Idf4dd83527d077043a5b69c43209cc2d0420720b

commit_message:
Revert "Check the service status during bootstrap against the internal VIP"

This reverts commit 05c64f7651a93bfa987a939fce680c3d4b13df30.

The idea of this healthcheck was to reach local address and see if service is up, rather then keystone_service_internaluri.
The thing is keystone_service_internaluri is behind haproxy, so during initial service bootstrap it will be down, as playbook does mark backends it runs against in haproxy. So this check can never be passed.

Change-Id: Iff916bc81064f2ce57b8e839583023d00c3384a7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_keystone refs/changes/35/858335/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adds primary/secondary multisite relation

A new relation with primary/secondary nomenclature is added and the
old master/slave relation is marked as *Deprecated*. In future,
master/slave relation would be completely removed.

Change-Id: I9cda48b74a20aaa9a41baedc79332bfaf13951d3
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/926

added_lines: description: /*Deprecated/* Use secondary relation interface: radosgw-multisite secondary: description: /*Deprecated/* Use primary relation interface: radosgw-multisite primary:

commit_message:
Install git into placement containers

If venv_wheel_build_enable is defined to False, placement will fail to
clone and install repositories due to missing git binary.

Change-Id: If1e3eec0c558d1472da7bc3a4e87825e36ba4fdc
Related-Bug: #1989506

commit_message:
[ovn] Specify port type if it's a router port when updating

In order to avoid multiple LogicalSwitchPortUpdateUpEvent and
LogicalSwitchPortUpdateDownEvent is mandatory to specify the
router port type when udpating the port.

If the port is not specified when updating the port, the
transactions will trigger a modification on the ovnnb db
that will set the port status to down[0]. Triggering an unnecessary
DownEvent followed by another UpEvent. Those unnecessary event
most likely will trigger a revision conflict.

[0] - https://github.com/ovn-org/ovn/blob/
4f93381d7d38aa21f56fb3ff4ec00490fca12614/northd/northd.c#L15604

Conflicts:
	neutron/common/ovn/constants.py

Closes-Bug: #1955578
Change-Id: I296003a936db16dd3a7d184ec44908fb3f261876
(cherry picked from commit 8c482b83f2cf6f5495f4df2e5698595db704798d)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/65/855065/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LSP_TYPE_LOCALPORT = 'localport' LSP_TYPE_ROUTER = 'router'

subject: [OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-21 14:22:04.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py', 'neutron/common/ovn/hash_ring_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/d0ade7e48c0f3da88e8e90aa1ff54dbd3d8efc12', 'message': '[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/33/858733/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Flag to rate limit the caching log self._prev_num_nodes = -1 num_nodes = len(nodes) if num_nodes >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", num_nodes, api_workers) # NOTE(lucasagomes): We only log when the number of connected # nodes are different to prevent this message from being spammed if self._prev_num_nodes != num_nodes: LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", num_nodes, api_workers) self._prev_num_nodes = num_nodes
deleted_lines: if len(nodes) >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", len(nodes), api_workers) LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", len(nodes), api_workers)

commit_message:
Handle several dhcp agents for metadata over ipv6

[0] added the capability to the dhcp agent of handling metadata traffic
over ipv6. However, the added code doesn't handle the case when a
network is managed by more than one dhcp agent. This change fixes the
issue.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/715482

Change-Id: Ie1e0739f2c7390031af196e72c678ee626d0f8b8
Closes-Bug: #1989979
(cherry picked from commit 41a7479d0f93ec2ff5019a1bfdc891dda5078d65)

added_lines: dhcp_port_this_host = copy.deepcopy(fake_dhcp_port) dhcp_port_this_host.device_id = utils.get_dhcp_agent_device_id( network.id, self.dhcp.conf.host) network.ports = [dhcp_port_this_host] dhcp_port_this_host = copy.deepcopy(fake_dhcp_port) dhcp_port_this_host.device_id = utils.get_dhcp_agent_device_id( network.id, self.dhcp.conf.host) network.ports = [dhcp_port_this_host] dhcp_port_this_host = copy.deepcopy(fake_dhcp_port) dhcp_port_this_host.device_id = utils.get_dhcp_agent_device_id( network.id, self.dhcp.conf.host) network.ports = [dhcp_port_this_host] self._test_enable_isolated_metadata_proxy_ipv6(network) def test_enable_isolated_metadata_proxy_with_2_agents_network_ipv6(self): network = copy.deepcopy(fake_meta_network) dhcp_port_this_host = copy.deepcopy(fake_dhcp_port) dhcp_port_this_host.device_id = utils.get_dhcp_agent_device_id( network.id, self.dhcp.conf.host) dhcp_port_other_host = copy.deepcopy(fake_dhcp_port) dhcp_port_other_host.device_id = utils.get_dhcp_agent_device_id( network.id, 'otherhostname') network.ports = [dhcp_port_this_host, dhcp_port_other_host]

commit_message:
Clarify description of encrypted volume transfer mv

This patch addresses a comment raised in the review of the feature,
I459f06504e90025c9c0b539981d3d56a2a9394c7.

Change-Id: I713ac84e4ed1617b29c0157e14931baefd626ce5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/07/855307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: When transferring an encrypted volume, its snapshots must also be transferred. Attempts to transfer an encrypted volume without transferring its snapshots are disallowed.

added_lines: from openstack.image.v2 import metadef_object 'created_at': '2014-09-19T18:20:56Z', 'description': 'You can configure the CPU limits with control parameters.', 'name': 'CPU Limits', 'properties': { 'quota:cpu_period': { 'description': "Specifies the enforcement interval (unit: microseconds) for QEMU and LXC hypervisors. Within a period, each VCPU of the domain is not allowed to consume more than the quota worth of runtime. The value should be in range [1000, 1000000]. A period with value 0 means no value.", 'maximum': 1000000, 'minimum': 1000, 'title': 'Quota: CPU Period', 'type': 'integer' }, 'quota:cpu_quota': { 'description': 'Specifies the maximum allowed bandwidth (unit: microseconds). A domain with a negative-value quota indicates that the domain has infinite bandwidth, which means that it is not bandwidth controlled. The value should be in range [1000, 18446744073709551] or less than 0. A quota with value 0 means no value. You can use this feature to ensure that all vCPUs run at the same speed.', 'title': 'Quota: CPU Quota', 'type': 'integer' }, 'quota:cpu_shares': { 'description': 'Specifies the proportional weighted share for the domain. If this element is omitted, the service defaults to the OS provided defaults. There is no unit for the value; it is a relative measure based on the setting of other VMs. For example, a VM configured with value 2048 gets twice as much CPU time as a VM configured with value 1024.', 'title': 'Quota: CPU Shares', 'type': 'integer' } }, 'updated_at': '2014-09-19T18:20:56Z' } class TestMetadefObject(base.TestCase): def test_basic(self): sot = metadef_object.MetadefObject() self.assertIsNone(sot.resource_key) self.assertEqual('objects', sot.resources_key) self.assertEqual('/metadefs/namespaces/%(namespace_name)s/objects', sot.base_path) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_commit) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_delete) self.assertTrue(sot.allow_list) def test_make_it(self): sot = metadef_object.MetadefObject(**EXAMPLE) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['name'], sot.name) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['updated_at'], sot.updated_at) self.assertDictEqual( { 'limit': 'limit', 'marker': 'marker', 'namespace_name': 'namespace_name', 'name': 'name', 'description': 'description', 'properties': 'properties', 'required': 'required', 'created_at': 'created_at', 'schema': 'schema', 'updated_at': 'updated_at' }, sot._query_mapping._mapping)
deleted_lines: import io import operator import tempfile from unittest import mock from keystoneauth1 import adapter import requests from openstack import _log from openstack import exceptions from openstack.image.v2 import metadef_object as _metadef_objectfrom openstack import utils 'created_at': '2022-09-02T01:05:00Z', 'name': 'foo', 'description': 'create new test object', 'namespace': 'test-namespace', 'properties': '[\'apple\', \'banana\']', 'updated_at': '2022-09-02T01:10:00Z' } class FakeResponse: def __init__(self, response, status_code=200, headers=None, reason=None): self.body = response self.content = response self.text = response self.status_code = status_code headers = headers if headers else {'content-type': 'application/json'} self.headers = requests.structures.CaseInsensitiveDict(headers) if reason: self.reason = reason # for the sake of "list" response faking self.links = [] def json(self): return self.body class TestMetadefObject(base.TestCase): def setUp(self): super(TestMetadefObject, self).setUp() self.resp = mock.Mock() self.resp.body = None self.resp.json = mock.Mock(return_value=self.resp.body) self.sess = mock.Mock(spec=adapter.Adapter) self.sess.post = mock.Mock(return_value=self.resp) self.sess.put = mock.Mock(return_value=FakeResponse({})) self.sess.delete = mock.Mock(return_value=FakeResponse({})) self.sess.get = mock.Mock(return_value=FakeResponse({})) self.sess.default_microversion = None self.sess.retriable_status_codes = None self.sess.log = _log.setup_logging('openstack') def test_basic(self): sot = _metadef_object.MetadefObject() self.assertEqual('/metadefs/namespaces', sot.base_path) self.assertDictEqual( { 'created_at': 'created_at', 'name': 'name', 'limit': 'limit', 'marker': 'marker', 'description': 'description', 'namespace': 'namespace', 'properties': 'properties', 'required': 'required', 'schema': 'schema', 'updated_at': 'updated_at' }, sot._query_mapping._mapping, ) def test_create(self): sot = _metadef_object.MetadefObject(**EXAMPLE) sot.create(self.sess) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['updated_at'], sot.updated_at) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['name'], sot.name) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['namespace'], sot.namespace) self.assertEqual(EXAMPLE['schema'], sot.schema) self.sess.post.assert_called_with('metadefs/namespaces/'+ EXAMPLE['namespace']+'/objects', json={'name': EXAMPLE['name'], 'properties': EXAMPLE['properties']})

commit_message:
Clarify description of encrypted volume transfer mv

This patch addresses a comment raised in the review of the feature,
I459f06504e90025c9c0b539981d3d56a2a9394c7.

Change-Id: I713ac84e4ed1617b29c0157e14931baefd626ce5
(cherry picked from commit 05e449adeb84f9302c17e9620108bc16fe1f4e56)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/09/858909/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Add the ability to transfer encrypted volumes and their snapshots. The feature removes a prior restriction on transferring encrypted volumes. Otherwise, the API request and response schema are unchanged.
deleted_lines: Add the ability to transfer encrypted volumes and their snapshots.

commit_message:
Add support for split view feature to designate

This change will add support for the following features
1. DNS View: which allow two views for the same zone
2. Split AXFR: the result of zone transfer will depend
   on the TSIG key view

Change-Id: Ia3d7ce2fb708d326b17d1e52de8267db9831f614
Closes-Bug: 1877681

commit_message:
Pdns4 driver adding TSIG key through pool.yaml

If the option `add_tsigkeys` is provided when using Pdns4
the listed TSIGkeys will be added to PowerDNS backend

Change-Id: Idf48fad73572e632dc3c1a24b696fbf7bacf0ad9
Closes-Bug: 1852902
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/61/755361/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.add_tsigkeys = self.options.get('add_tsigkeys', None) def _build_url_tsigkey(self, key=''): r_url = urllib.parse.urlparse(self.api_endpoint) return "%s://%s/api/v1/servers/localhost/tsigkeys%s%s" % ( r_url.scheme, r_url.netloc, '/' if key else '', key) def _check_tsigkey_exists(self, keyname): zone = requests.get( self._build_url_tsigkey(key=keyname), headers=self.headers, ) return zone.status_code == 200 def _create_tsigkeys(self): """Create tsigkeys in powerdns""" if not self.add_tsigkeys: return tsigkeys = self.add_tsigkeys.split(',') for tsigkey in tsigkeys: try: name, algorithm, secret = tsigkey.split(':') if not all((name, algorithm, secret)): raise ValueError if self._check_tsigkey_exists(name): LOG.info("Tsigkey already exists: %s" % name) continue data = { "name": name, "algorithm": algorithm, "key": secret } requests.post( self._build_url_tsigkey(), json=data, headers=self.headers ).raise_for_status() except requests.HTTPError as e: LOG.warn('Error Creating Tsigkey: %s' % e) except ValueError: LOG.warn("Wrong value provided for Tsigkey to add " "%s" % tsigkey) # Create the tsigkeys if there is any self._create_tsigkeys()

subject: [stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lowwer-constraints
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-08-02 17:54:27.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/requirements.txt', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/0672ec0612bf534c3d97447327abc63f8522db21', 'message': "[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lowwer-constraints

bandit 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the
release is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to
1.6.2 when using py2.

With the new pip dependency resolver (introduced in pip 20.3) the
lower-constraints job started to fail. Problem is here with the
'install_command' in tox.ini, which uses both the upper- and lower-
constraints files, causing the job to fail. This patch adds separate
install_command without the upper constraints, so that only the
lower-constraints.txt is used.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: If8738f5005e60cf46ed93edbefa272bc2611b53f
(cherry picked from commit 86544150913bcd819b4ee8d77e83d2566142fb41)
"}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lowwer-constraints

bandit 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the
release is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to
1.6.2 when using py2.

With the new pip dependency resolver (introduced in pip 20.3) the
lower-constraints job started to fail. Problem is here with the
'install_command' in tox.ini, which uses both the upper- and lower-
constraints files, causing the job to fail. This patch adds separate
install_command without the upper constraints, so that only the
lower-constraints.txt is used.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: If8738f5005e60cf46ed93edbefa272bc2611b53f
(cherry picked from commit 86544150913bcd819b4ee8d77e83d2566142fb41)

commit_message:
Allow project readers to read pools API

When creating a zone, users are able to use the attributes field to
hint to the attributes scheduler (if available) which pool to
use for the zone. By allowing users read access to the pools API,
they will be able to discover which attributes and pools are available
without needing to consult either the cloud operator or cloud-specific
documentation.

Change-Id: I1a5f7dfee3d1a5a8b1930c16bdf2efb7a31d17f6

commit_message:
Signed notifications to Designate backend

Notify and also_notify to Designate backend will
be able to sign the notification if the TsigKey
is provided

Closes-Bug: 1875939

commit_message:
Adding split horizon documentation

The documentaion explains in detail how to enable the split horizon
DNS feature and configure it.

Change-Id: Ie5a01f8df00edb7d67ab2db86b889ecac0d0efb0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/26/754226/21 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. Copyright 2016 Rackspace Hosting Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License. =============================== How To Configure Split Horizon =============================== Split horizon is an important feature most DNS servers have support for based on the need to split internal, external view of the IPs and hostnames. Designate support this through the use of :ref:`pools` and :ref:`../configuration/index` as explained below Pools Configuration =================== Pools are configured by a `pools.yml` file. This file describes the pools and can be used to update Designate via `designate-manage` commands. Here is an example `pools.yml` that configures two different pools. The idea to configure two backend targets that hold two different view of the same zone created on Designate as the below example for bind, powerdns explains .. note:: Please refer to `Understanding views in BIND 9 <https://kb.isc.org/docs/aa-00851>`_ and `Running Virtual Instances <https://doc.powerdns.com/authoritative/guides/virtual-instances.html>`_ for PowerDns .. code-block:: yaml --- - name: default description: Split Horizon Pool ns_records: - hostname: ns1.devstack.org. priority: 1 nameservers: - host: 10.0.2.15 port: 53 targets: - type: bind9 description: BIND Instance masters: - host: 10.0.2.15 port: 5354 options: host: 10.0.2.15 port: 53 rndc_host: 10.0.2.15 rndc_port: 953 allow_transfer: external notification_tsigkey: external view: external rndc_config_file: /etc/named/rndc.conf rndc_key_file: /etc/named/rndc.key - type: bind9 description: BIND Instance masters: - host: 10.0.2.15 port: 5354 options: host: 10.0.2.15 port: 53 rndc_host: 10.0.2.15 rndc_port: 953 notification_tsigkey: internal allow_transfer: internal view: internal rndc_config_file: /etc/named/rndc.conf rndc_key_file: /etc/named/rndc.key - type: pdns4 description: PowerDNS4 DNS Server masters: - host: 10.0.2.15 port: 5354 options: host: 10.0.2.15 port: 5351 notification_tsigkey: internal add_tsigkeys: "internal:hmac-md5:j10uJPBhPhhmmDhUwZmqQg==,external:hmac-md5:DLYrQqPB6ZJMCO/yYQP7/w==" api_endpoint: http://10.0.2.15:8082 tsigkey_name: internal api_token: secret - type: pdns4 description: PowerDNS4 DNS Server masters: - host: 10.0.2.15 port: 5354 options: host: 10.0.2.15 port: 5352 add_tsigkeys: "internal:hmac-md5:j10uJPBhPhhmmDhUwZmqQg==,external:hmac-md5:DLYrQqPB6ZJMCO/yYQP7/w==" notification_tsigkey: external tsigkey_name: external api_endpoint: http://10.0.2.15:8081 api_token: secret also_notifies: - host: 10.0.2.15 port: 53 notification_tsigkey: "external" - host: 10.0.2.15 port: 53 notification_tsigkey: "internal" .. note:: * `notification_tsigkey` is the `TSIG` key used to sing the notifications sent to DNS server * Pdns4 `add_tsigkeys` is the `TSIG` key to be added to the Pdns4 server For bind the additional configurations below should be added to `named.conf` .. code:: ini key "external" { algorithm hmac-md5; secret "DLYrQqPB6ZJMCO/yYQP7/w=="; }; key "internal" { algorithm hmac-md5; secret "j10uJPBhPhhmmDhUwZmqQg=="; }; // INTERNAL view "internal" { server 10.0.2.15 { keys internal; }; match-clients { key internal; !key external; any;}; }; // EXTERNAL view "external" { server 10.0.2.15 { keys external; }; match-clients { key external; !key internal; any;}; }; The above configurations will enable the split horizon feature for Bind and Powerdns with the configuration in place, we can then update Designate to use the pool configuration. .. code-block:: bash # Do a dry run $ designate-manage pool update --file pools.yml --dry-run $ designate-manage pool update --file pools.yml Designate now has two pools to work with. The next step will be to configure the Desigante MDNS to return the records based on the `TSIG` key `AXFR` is signed with Designate Configurations ======================== Designate MDNS is reponsible for handling `AXFR` zone transfer adding the following configurations will allow the MDNS to answer `AXFR` based on the `TSIG` key used for the request .. code-block:: ini [service:mdns] tsigkey_view_map = external : (?!10\.\d+\.\d+\.\d+|172\.(1[6-9]|2[0-9]|3[01])\.\d+\.\d+|192\.168\.\d+\.\d+) the above `service:mdns` configuration will make Designate MDNS exclude the local network A IPs from the records returned when external `TSIG` key is used to sign the `AXFR` request.

subject: sqlalchemy: Fix migrations for PostgreSQL
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-07-01 15:38:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/79536b5e4a4a78249305d62dd084d4b70dae33da', 'message': 'sqlalchemy: Update migrations for PostgreSQL

PostgreSQL requires no name for the column and a name for the enum.

Change-Id: Id87bd31513517190474f425acc1b6b0d77279108
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2019-07-01 18:34:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/63855568bb8ac8193d1e3b2c09a74d4e0e731b22', 'message': 'sqlalchemy: Update migrations for PostgreSQL

PostgreSQL requires no name for the column, but does require a name for
the enum.

This fixes:

sqlalchemy.exc.CompileError: PostgreSQL ENUM type requires a name.

oslo_db.exception.DBMigrationError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) column "type" of relation "recordsets" already exists
 [SQL: '\nALTER TABLE recordsets RENAME COLUMN type TO type'] (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/f405)

Change-Id: Id87bd31513517190474f425acc1b6b0d77279108
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2019-07-02 06:15:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/5fb60a32374109cf81fafb348f04f95d68d74824', 'message': 'sqlalchemy: Fix migrations for PostgreSQL

PostgreSQL does not support specifying the same name for the column, but
does require a name for the enum.

This fixes:

sqlalchemy.exc.CompileError: PostgreSQL ENUM type requires a name.

oslo_db.exception.DBMigrationError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) column "type" of relation "recordsets" already exists
 [SQL: '\nALTER TABLE recordsets RENAME COLUMN type TO type'] (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/f405)

Change-Id: Id87bd31513517190474f425acc1b6b0d77279108
Closes-Bug: 1834993
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2019-07-02 06:50:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/97be6cc3afdf0838fa99ce31f704540f35bc7c4a', 'message': 'sqlalchemy: Fix migrations for PostgreSQL

PostgreSQL does not support specifying the same name for the column, but
does require a name for the enum.

commit_message:
sqlalchemy: Fix migrations for PostgreSQL

PostgreSQL does not support specifying the same name for the column, but
does require a name for the enum.

This fixes:

sqlalchemy.exc.CompileError: PostgreSQL ENUM type requires a name.

oslo_db.exception.DBMigrationError: (psycopg2.ProgrammingError) column "type" of relation "recordsets" already exists
 [SQL: '\nALTER TABLE recordsets RENAME COLUMN type TO type'] (Background on this error at: http://sqlalche.me/e/f405)

Change-Id: Id87bd31513517190474f425acc1b6b0d77279108
Closes-Bug: 1834993
Signed-off-by: Sven Wegener <sven.wegener@inovex.de>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/93/668493/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow NS records for child zone in parent zone

In order for DNS recursion to work properly in cases where a
child zone (foo.example.org) doesn't exist on the same authoritative
server as the parent zone (example.org), users should be allowed to
add NS records for child zones to existing parent
zones.

Closes-Bug: 1917099
Change-Id: Id4da1901b6e2e689c5962d8739695c8fa6f2c5bf

subject: Allow update status with all_tenants=True context
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-02-08 04:24:49.000000000', 'files': ['designate/worker/tasks/zone.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/84ab48b4fa4548e070b9a588e4fc216b2e77a653', 'message': 'Allow update status with all_tenants=True context

When zone create and then transfer request create and then transfer
request accept happens in sequence all within less than 5 seconds,
and also update_status is triggered with zone previous owning user
and project - the query of find_zones return zone not found. Thus when
transfer request is accepted by target user and project, zone remains in
PENDING state for at least around 5+ minutes, until worker threads
detect zone in PENDING state and move it to ACTIVE state.
The above bug will be fixed by allowing the update_status with
all_tenants, i.e. find_zones will return the zone in query and its
status will become ACTIVE as usual.

Closes-Bug: #1914934
Change-Id: I76e3f7e3c6878af32e1ca641670b17df838ee0f0
'}]
commit_message:
Allow update status with all_tenants=True context

When zone create and then transfer request create and then transfer
request accept happens in sequence all within less than 5 seconds,
and also update_status is triggered with zone previous owning user
and project - the query of find_zones return zone not found. Thus when
transfer request is accepted by target user and project, zone remains in
PENDING state for at least around 5+ minutes, until worker threads
detect zone in PENDING state and move it to ACTIVE state.
The above bug will be fixed by allowing the update_status with
all_tenants, i.e. find_zones will return the zone in query and its
status will become ACTIVE as usual.

Closes-Bug: #1914934
Change-Id: I76e3f7e3c6878af32e1ca641670b17df838ee0f0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/89/774389/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.context = context.elevated(all_tenants=True)

commit_message:
fix bug: secondary zone loop xfr

when create a secondary zone.the zone will perform zone xfr from master.
Normally, only one xfr should be performed. but not is loop xfr.

this patch fix it.

Partial-bug: #1856442

Change-Id: I4cdef86ef4412eb92668bb08a5de73249f23ca9a

commit_message:
fix database sync always get the wrong  value

we create a default pool  when exec database sync, and get the
default_pool_id from designate.conf, but we did not register this
opt before using  it, so we always get the default value which is
wrong

Change-Id: I500c932a502db24332aad95c54713b7056bc1df4
Closes-Bug: 1881277
Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1855877
(cherry picked from commit 609437e73deff55e9f5548538f093d01f0addd1b)

commit_message:
fix database sync always get the wrong  value

we create a default pool  when exec database sync, and get the
default_pool_id from designate.conf, but we did not register this
opt before using  it, so we always get the default value which is
wrong

Change-Id: I500c932a502db24332aad95c54713b7056bc1df4
Closes-Bug: 1881277
Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1855877
(cherry picked from commit 609437e73deff55e9f5548538f093d01f0addd1b)

Add the placement api to vagrant local.conf when nova is enabled

Without the placement api nova-conductor will fail to start and
devstack will fail.

Change-Id: Ie737df9fe400fa0292f60b69c789231a46c73db7

commit_message:
Add validation for "record" field

Currently, "Create Record Set" modal window allows uploading of empty
records. Proposed patch adds some validation for this input.

Change-Id: Ie737df9fe400fa0292f60b69c789231a46c73db7

commit_message:
Add default policy files

These are consumed by Horizon and were generated
according to these instructions:

https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/contributor/topics/policy.html#policy-file-maintenance

These files need to be copied into Horizon's conf directory
(e.g. /etc/openstack_dashboard) at install time.

Change-Id: I30f9f89744b5d71985df924543c6e1cf8ea816f2

commit_message:
Release ec2api-tempest-plugin for Zed

This patch proposes a release for ec2api-tempest-plugin
to get the latest merged changes out prior to the final Zed going
into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by early Friday, September 23.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Iaab4c6b044bb1e02ae8c58d2f6a2155061f8c5a8

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I744d20d2aca7966c98526b4295b60d632e77a012

commit_message:
Remove neutron-lbaas from the CI jobs requirements

Neutron-lbaas was retired some time ago [1] so there's no need
to keep it in the requirements of the CI jobs.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-May/006158.html

Change-Id: I8e99d7c76dff1ba594385b828fabdf5ab94b9b1f

In large environments, it's possible that we have more than 10,000 objects.

In large environments, it's possible that we have more than 10,000 objects.
We set 10,000 as the limit for Swifts container_listing_limit config option.

This change adds the full_listing=True option while calling get_container().

commit_message:
[TRAIN-ONLY] Use full_listing with Swift get_container

In large environments, it's possible that we have more than 10,000 objects.
We set 10,000 as the limit for Swifts container_listing_limit config option.

This change adds the full_listing=True option while calling get_container().

Related: rhbz#2119145
Change-Id: I83d5e0be8c76f8e8b34c62b8b59a7e963a78a4c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/22/854722/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # In large environments. It's possible that we have greater than 10,000 # objects in the container. We need to call get_container() with # full_listing=True # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2119145 objects = swiftclient.get_container(container, full_listing=True)[1]

commit_message:
Release freezer-tempest-plugin for Zed

This patch proposes a release for freezer-tempest-plugin
to get the latest merged changes out prior to the final Zed going
into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by early Friday, September 23.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: I604e149e9e13e8b14af61d8e474a3910549ecccd

commit_message:
Allow axfr for zones with different pool_id

The current implementation limits AXFR to the
default pool when the dns server isn't providing
a tsigkey.

Change-Id: Ia1bc4aea7a4d9daeb6aa9dcfbb7defc816f592eb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/30/681130/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not tsigkey and CONF['service:mdns'].query_enforce_tsig: if tsigkey: raise NotImplementedError( "Support for '%s' scoped TSIG Keys is not implemented" % tsigkey.scope )
deleted_lines: if tsigkey is None and CONF['service:mdns'].query_enforce_tsig: elif tsigkey is None: # Default to using the default_pool_id when no TSIG key is # available criterion['pool_id'] = CONF['service:central'].default_pool_id else: raise NotImplementedError('Support for %s scoped TSIG Keys is ' 'not implemented')

commit_message:
Switch cinder-backup default to active-active

Currently, cinder-backup deployment defaults to active-passive.
This patch will update the environment file cinder-backup.yaml
to use active-active deployment.

Change-Id: I2164d3a921903d6886aa5fa66b300e01081b93a7

commit_message:
Fix Barbican gate

This patch fixes a zuul syntax error due to a deprecated definition that
was still in use in our configuration.

It also makes the grenade job non-voting as it is currently failing.  A
follow up patch will fix grenade and re-enable voting.

Change-Id: I271a3d50dba5f1c7c58c01838fa68b4c8adbd72c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican refs/changes/05/858205/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Migration ceph stable charms to charmhub - octopus

This is the stable/octopus branch of the ceph charms.  It tests against
focal-ussuri and bionic-ussuri (validates octopus).

As a minor fix-up, it also adds a versioned upstream zuul job
to handle check and gate pipelines without breaking on future releases.

Change-Id: If42fd19881a74afa7533cd8ce4889f9fc53d401f

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie164a66bddcdb4768e6488fc2ea813b2e463c9d5

commit_message:
Fix ansible-openstack-collection version

With latest collection openstacksdk 0.101 is required. But then we need also
to install additional packages for oslo.cache backend, which will cause
circular dependency.

Change-Id: I3926dd5c533cb47590a11b81078a322f9be14256

commit_message:
Handle several dhcp agents for metadata over ipv6

[0] added the capability to the dhcp agent of handling metadata traffic
over ipv6. However, the added code doesn't handle the case when a
network is managed by more than one dhcp agent. This change fixes the
issue.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/715482

Change-Id: Ie1e0739f2c7390031af196e72c678ee626d0f8b8
Closes-Bug: #1989979
(cherry picked from commit 41a7479d0f93ec2ff5019a1bfdc891dda5078d65)

subject: [OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-21 14:21:24.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py', 'neutron/common/ovn/hash_ring_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7721c6982b2cddee02d807cf4905a54f90358cd9', 'message': '[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/29/858729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Flag to rate limit the caching log self._prev_num_nodes = -1 num_nodes = len(nodes) if num_nodes >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", num_nodes, api_workers) # NOTE(lucasagomes): We only log when the number of connected # nodes are different to prevent this message from being spammed if self._prev_num_nodes != num_nodes: LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", num_nodes, api_workers) self._prev_num_nodes = num_nodes
deleted_lines: if len(nodes) >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", len(nodes), api_workers) LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", len(nodes), api_workers)

commit_message:
Remove "dhcp_agent_scheduler" API extension from common list

Common list of extensions is used in all jobs definitions and
"dhcp_agent_scheduler" shouldn't be on that list as it isn't available
e.g. in jobs with enabled distributed-dhcp and disabled dhcp agent.

Closes-Bug: #1990629
Change-Id: I689757fedf9cdf70760cc48596d8c936ca7a3c55

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

commit_message:
Do not allow a tenant to create a default SG for another one

The attempt to list security groups for a project, or any
random string, can create a default SG for it. Only allow if
privileges support it.

Closes-bug: #1988026

Change-Id: Ieef7011f48cd2188d4254ff16d90a6465bbabfe3
(cherry picked from commit 01fc2b9195f999df4d810df4ee63f77ecbc81f7e)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic4f48eb0eb3b542a0b0ee0bf9c5f1090efab0860

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

subject: [OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-21 14:21:33.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py', 'neutron/common/ovn/hash_ring_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/564e83635885639177835e1cfcd3c73e66d82723', 'message': '[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)
'}]
commit_message:
[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/30/858730/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Flag to rate limit the caching log self._prev_num_nodes = -1 num_nodes = len(nodes) if num_nodes >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", num_nodes, api_workers) # NOTE(lucasagomes): We only log when the number of connected # nodes are different to prevent this message from being spammed if self._prev_num_nodes != num_nodes: LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", num_nodes, api_workers) self._prev_num_nodes = num_nodes
deleted_lines: if len(nodes) >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", len(nodes), api_workers) LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", len(nodes), api_workers)

commit_message:
new tht for Cinder NFS backend

Currently, Cinder NFS storage backend is configured as part of
cinder-volume-container-puppet.yaml.

This change will just relocate the existing cinder NFS parameters in their
own template. There are no new parameters, and the existing parameters
retain the same default values.

Change-Id: I10364adb761cc225173cc437cf2876ed7e896f19

commit_message:
Fix typo when nova pool is built and wrong flag during cli creation

When the upgrade from nautilus to pacific is performed, the regular
cephadm playbook fails during pools creation. This is caused due to a
typo in the build_pools task that processes the vms pool. In addition,
during the same run, if no spec is present, post.yaml fails getting the
right cli due to a wrong 'mount_spec' flag value. This change fixes both
failures removing the extra space that caused the pool creation failure
and the mount_spec flag that caused an issue in the get_cli task.

Closes-Bug: #1990195

Signed-off-by: Francesco Pantano <fpantano@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I253c8feb72404e2620821472447b08905d5cd16b
(cherry picked from commit b200d84dd1d71e2f500c5bf149e81f72ab3a03d3)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/37/858637/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Migration ceph stable charms to charmhub - pacific

This is the stable/pacific branch of the ceph charms.  It tests against
focal-ussuri (validates octopus) and focal-wallaby (validates pacific).

As a minor fix-up, it also adds a versioned upstream zuul job
to handle check and gate pipelines without breaking on future releases.

Change-Id: Idda6cecbf3dcb5a42c67c358c8d259d782bb08e1
func-test-pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/919

commit_message:
Implement prometheus alert rules

Alert rules can be attached as a resource and will be transmitted via
the metrics-endpoint relation. Default alert rules taken from upstream
ceph have been added for reference.

Change-Id: I6a3c6f06e9b9d911b35c8ced1968becc6471b362

commit_message:
Fix: run main procedures in ops charm

Previously, before converting to the operator framework, the charm
used to run default processes on every hook run, due to the __main__
block in the ceph_hooks module. This patch aims to resurrect these
default processes for the operator charm.

Change-Id: Iffaec5287f248f61b737d79a1ea945e3125255d9

In tripleo-ansible-ee yaml file, ANSIBLE_RUNNER_IMAGE is overriden

commit_message:
Drop ANSIBLE_RUNNER_IMAGE from tcib_args

In Downstream, Openshift Build System(OSBS) is used to build
the container image.

In tripleo-ansible-ee yaml file, ANSIBLE_RUNNER_IMAGE is overriden
via tcib_args during tcib container build process but
OSBS does not overrides the ANSIBLE_RUNNER_IMAGE arg from FROM
instructions due to
https://github.com/containerbuildsystem/dockerfile-parse/issues/118.

It is not clear when the above issue will get fixed.
In order to unblock the pipeline and to have a proper fix
in place, we are going to using the default image name in tcib_from
argument.

In Downstream, tcib_from will be overriden with downstream
image.

Related-Bug: rhbz#2128230

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I81f911500ba620b27707075ef4fda8d52b2a5831
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/64/858864/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow console stream for standalone

While the console is working, it's relying on the "established" state -
if, for any reason, the stream dies, it won't be able to restart
properly.

We already address this case for Undercloud and Overcloud in another
patch:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/857096

The standalone case was overlooked, since it was working just fine.

Change-Id: Idcaaed92e6cc6e5554f1c22d129d962e8daa7272

commit_message:
Container build: define ARGs after FROM line

According to the Dockerfile reference[1], ARG instructions before the
FROM line are a special case: variables defined in this way are only
available in the FROM line and not during the rest of the build.

In order for defined ARGs to be available during image build time we
must run these after the FROM line.

[1] https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#understand-how-arg-and-from-interact

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/858864
Signed-off-by: Miguel Garcia <mgarciac@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8086b7820ff2d124baacbe8e947aba970996b907

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I69f1f440be813a9e3b21227c329dad8c5cbb1464

commit_message:
CI: Fix/Update a few more jobs

Fix the postgres CI job by setting it to partition image only.

Disable the IPv6 job from running, it appears tempest is no longer
compatible with it's setup in this context and it had a higher
failure rate which kept it from being voting job, so it just doesn't
need to run now.

Set the dib build job to wholedisk only, as the image built is
a wholedisk image.

Disable ironic-tempest-ipa-partition-uefi-pxe_ipmitool, as it was
previously failing freqently due to memory consumption required.
Now it is also failing due to memory quota enforcement coming out
of nova, meaning we are likely to never fix this job on this branch.

Explicitly set the standalone job to no-bios, as the default devstack
order is fake,no-bios.

Change-Id: I6ef41d66b4c4f1a5ec532ee36fc36e98aa82655f

As this was already a test which had a high failure rate # due to dhcp issues, we are unlikely to fix it. # - ironic-tempest-ipxe-ipv6: # voting: false

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I436130165e066f5c42fc664e7606ee6ad99857e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient refs/changes/28/859128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/zed} -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/zed} -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/zed}

commit_message:
Release networking-generic-switch for Zed

This proposed a release for networking-generic-switch to get any merged changes
out for Zed.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by early Friday, September 16.

Signed-off-by: Armstrong Foundjem <foundjem@ieee.org>
Change-Id: If41dcc448956ef110ff9a0f381f7adb463fadfaa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/releases refs/changes/24/857224/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

blockquotes. We also have a load of literals/code. Mark them as such.

Change-Id: I59c09c88a68f617f03a1753332ffb5311f8806a6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
docs: Remove errant indentation, mark up literals

Bullet points shouldn't be preceded by a space. Doing so renders them as
blockquotes. We also have a load of literals/code. Mark them as such.

Change-Id: I59c09c88a68f617f03a1753332ffb5311f8806a6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/77/859077/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: manage. However, the ``subnet_allocation`` [1]_ extension is an exception and will* The Quota API extensions. * The Quota Engine.* ``neutron.db.quota.driver.DbQuotaDriver`` * ``neutron.db.quota.driver_nolock.DbQuotaNoLockDriver`` (default)The ``_update_attributes`` method is called only once in the controller lifetime.quotas using ``policy.yaml``.* ``delete_tenant_quota``, which simply removes all entries from the 'quotas' table for a given project identifier; * ``update_quota_limit``, which adds or updates an entry in the 'quotas' project for a given project identifier and a given resource name; * ``_get_quotas``, which fetches limits for a set of resource and a given project identifier * ``_get_all_quotas``, which behaves like ``_get_quotas``, but for all projects.* ``CountableResource``, where resource usage is calculated every time quotas limits are enforced by counting rows in the resource table or resources tables and reservations for that resource. * ``TrackedResource``, depends on the selected driver: * ``DbQuotaDriver``: the resource usage relies on a specific table tracking usage data, and performs explicitly counting only when the data in this table are not in sync with actual used and reserved resources. * ``DbQuotaNoLockDriver``: the resource usage is counted directly from the database table associated to the resource. In this new driver, ``CountableResource`` and ``TrackedResource`` could look similar but ``TrackedResource`` depends on one single database model (table) and the resource count is done directly on this table only. Another difference between ``CountableResource`` and ``TrackedResource`` is that the former invokes a plugin method to count resources. ``CountableResource`` should be``track_quota_usage`` variable in the quota configuration section. If ``True``, ``TrackedResource`` instances will be created, otherwise the quota engine will use ``CountableResource`` instances. Resource creation is performed by the ``create_resource_instance`` factory method in the ``neutron.quota.resource`` module.records in the table. On the other hand, using ``TrackedResource`` will fetch aNevertheless, ``CountableResource`` instances do not simply perform a SELECT queryTo this aim, ``TrackedResource`` instances are initialised with a reference to* Updating the usage counters with the new 'correct' value every time an operation completes. * Having a periodic task synchronising quota usage data with actual data in the Neutron DB.Each ``TrackedResource`` is linked to a database table that stores the tracked* Clean up the expired reservations. The amount of expired reservations is always limited because of the short timeout set (2 minutes). * Retrieve the used resources for a specific project. This query retrieves only the "project_id" column of the resource to avoid backref requests; that limits the scope of the query and speeds up it. * Retrieve the reserved resources, created by other concurrent operations. * If there is enough quota, create a new reservation register.Regardless of whether ``CountableResource`` or ``TrackedResource`` is used, the quota engine always invokes its ``count()`` method to retrieve resource usage.difference between ``CountableResource`` and ``TrackedResource``.Reservations are made by calling the ``make_reservation`` method in ``neutron.quota.QuotaEngine``.* Get current resource usages. This is achieved by invoking the count method on every requested resource, and then retrieving the amount of reserved resources. * Fetch current quota limits for requested resources, by invoking the ``_get_project_quotas`` method. * Fetch expired reservations for selected resources. This amount will be subtracted from resource usage. As in most cases there won't be any expired reservation, this approach actually requires less DB operations than doing a sum of non-expired, reserved resources for each request. * For each resource calculate its headroom, and verify the requested amount of resource is less than the headroom. * If the above is true for all resource, the reservation is saved in the DB, otherwise an ``OverQuotaLimit`` exception is raised.``neutron_lib.db.api.retry_db_errors`` will retry the transaction if a DBDeadLockhandling a ``DBDeadlock`` is still lower than the cost of retrying the operationcancelling a reservation (i.e. the request failed to complete), and also marks quota usage info as dirty when the reservation is committed (i.e.``commit_reservation`` and ``cancel_reservation`` methods in ``neutron.quota.QuotaEngine``. @resource_registry.tracked_resources(network=models_v2.Network,exclusively to ``__init__`` methods. However, this would eventually lead toencourage to apply this decorator exclusively to the plugin's ``__init__``* Subnet allocation from subnet pools, in particularly shared pools, is also subject to quota limit checks. However this checks are not enforced by the quota engine, but trough a mechanism implemented in the ``neutron.ipam.subnetalloc`` module. This is because the quota engine is not able to satisfy the requirements for quotas on subnet allocation. * The quota engine also provides a ``limit_check`` routine which enforces quota checks without creating reservations. This way of doing quota enforcement is extremely unreliable and superseded by the reservation mechanism. It has not been removed to ensure off-tree plugins and extensions which leverage are not broken. * SqlAlchemy events might not be the most reliable way for detecting changes in resource usage. Since the event mechanism monitors the data model class, it is paramount for a correct quota enforcement, that resources are always created and deleted using object relational mappings. For instance, deleting a resource with a ``query.delete`` call will not trigger the event. SQLAlchemy events should be considered as a temporary measure adopted as Neutron lacks persistent API objects. * As ``CountableResource`` instance do not track usage data, when making a reservation no write-intent lock is acquired. Therefore the quota engine with ``CountableResource`` is not concurrency-safe. * The mechanism for specifying for which resources enable usage tracking relies on the fact that the plugin is loaded before quota-limited resources are registered. For this reason it is not possible to validate whether a resource actually exists or not when enabling tracking for it. Developers should pay particular attention into ensuring resource names are correctly specified. * The code assumes usage trackers are a trusted source of truth: if they report a usage counter and the dirty bit is not set, that counter is correct. If it's dirty than surely that counter is out of sync. This is not very robust, as there might be issues upon restart when toggling the use_tracked_resources configuration variable, as stale counters might be trusted upon for making reservations. Also, the same situation might occur if a server crashes after the API operation is completed but before the reservation is committed, as the actual resource usage is changed but the corresponding usage tracker is not marked as dirty.

commit_message:
Creating stable zed for mistral-lib

If you want to wait and make another release before the branch is cut,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that
patch to include another release and stable branch point.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday September 23.

Change-Id: I5b7a8a8a6bfc91963594814beeea83eb603b6e05

commit_message:
Creating stable zed for python-mistralclient

If you want to wait and make another release before the branch is cut,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that
patch to include another release and stable branch point.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday September 23.

Change-Id: If57d8f65dcf50f8aad336ff633bcbda33979240e

commit_message:
Remove skips for bug 1793482

These tests already running fine in wallaby but due
to the skips master is missing coverage. Let's drop
the skiplist for all the tests which included master
as a release.

Related-Bug: #1793482
Change-Id: I8fb90b88c18109d9db51f184271ffe403605244f

commit_message:
Creating stable zed for mistral-extra

If you want to wait and make another release before the branch is cut,
someone from the team can -1 the patch to have it held, or update that
patch to include another release and stable branch point.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday September 23.

Change-Id: Id648e764b722f165030d0d5fc06b171fff1c8d8b

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4de2322e54d71f1dccd1b72377a24ab6b5561e9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/adjutant-ui refs/changes/19/859119/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: deps = -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/zed}deps = -c{env:TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/zed}

Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3994feb0cfa80ed5e72524de26fdadbe4bccb9c7

commit_message:
Fix queue declaration

This patch fixes the queue declaration to move it to the project
definition.  The current definition has been deprecated [1] and needs to
be fixed to unblock the gate.

[1] https://lists.zuul-ci.org/pipermail/zuul-discuss/2022-May/001801.html

Change-Id: I0f2fda64de9edcaa56afee5b896e90bafde94b5e

commit_message:
Release monasca-events-api RC1 for Zed

This proposed a RC1 release for monasca-events-api to get any merged changes
out prior to the RC1 deadline for Zed going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by early Friday, September 16.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Ica8f56910499f7935331fac9aa41ce562370df7c

subject: Python 3.8+ has better shutil.copytree()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-14 13:52:36.000000000', 'files': ['kolla/image/build.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/0e3a55252b04e8e81db7b0f5636fb6624824a5cb', 'message': 'Python 3.8+ has better shutil.copytree()

doc says:

> If dirs_exist_ok is false (the default) and dst already exists, a
> FileExistsError is raised. If dirs_exist_ok is true, the copying
> operation will continue if it encounters existing directories, and files
> within the dst tree will be overwritten by corresponding files from the
> src tree.

So we do not have to copy dirs/files one by one and tell
shutil.copytree() to handle everything.

Change-Id: I97d9c8261351b8fd88f088c1463cc508e07792e7
'}]
commit_message:
Python 3.8+ has better shutil.copytree()

doc says:

> If dirs_exist_ok is false (the default) and dst already exists, a
> FileExistsError is raised. If dirs_exist_ok is true, the copying
> operation will continue if it encounters existing directories, and files
> within the dst tree will be overwritten by corresponding files from the
> src tree.

So we do not have to copy dirs/files one by one and tell
shutil.copytree() to handle everything.

Change-Id: I97d9c8261351b8fd88f088c1463cc508e07792e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/09/857709/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: shutil.copytree(src, dest, dirs_exist_ok=True)
deleted_lines: if not os.path.isdir(dest): shutil.copytree(src, dest) else: for file in os.listdir(src): src_path = os.path.join(src, file) dest_path = os.path.join(dest, file) if os.path.isdir(src_path): self.copy_dir(src_path, dest_path) else: shutil.copy2(src_path, dest_path)

commit_message:
Handle several dhcp agents for metadata over ipv6

[0] added the capability to the dhcp agent of handling metadata traffic
over ipv6. However, the added code doesn't handle the case when a
network is managed by more than one dhcp agent. This change fixes the
issue.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/715482

Change-Id: Ie1e0739f2c7390031af196e72c678ee626d0f8b8
Closes-Bug: #1989979
(cherry picked from commit 41a7479d0f93ec2ff5019a1bfdc891dda5078d65)

if it doesn't exist. A warning log is left so that operators can be

commit_message:
rbd: Fix snapshot delete when the source volume doesn't exist

Currently snapshot delete requires access to the source volume and
the operation fails if the source volume doesn't exist in the backend.
This prevents some snapshots from being deleted when the source volume
image is deleted from the backend for some reason (for example, after
cluster format).

This change makes the rbd driver to skip updating the source volume
if it doesn't exist. A warning log is left so that operators can be
aware of any skip event.

Closes-Bug: #1957073
Change-Id: Icd9dad9ad7b3ad71b3962b078e5b94670ac41c87
(cherry picked from commit 3ddf7ca9ea9587318b8c903e2c43b1879846d1c2)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/24/858624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | RBD Driver `bug #1957073 <https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1957073>`_: Snapshot delete now succeeds and skips updating the source volume image if the image does not exist in the backend.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-21 14:21:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py', 'neutron/common/ovn/hash_ring_manager.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9f36ab53b49c1f83e6df7737c4e92b41e9658660', 'message': '[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes

at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the

commit_message:
[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/28/858728/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Flag to rate limit the caching log self._prev_num_nodes = -1 num_nodes = len(nodes) if num_nodes >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", num_nodes, api_workers) # NOTE(lucasagomes): We only log when the number of connected # nodes are different to prevent this message from being spammed if self._prev_num_nodes != num_nodes: LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", num_nodes, api_workers) self._prev_num_nodes = num_nodes
deleted_lines: if len(nodes) >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", len(nodes), api_workers) LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", len(nodes), api_workers)

commit_message:
[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)

commit_message:
Exclude kernel from dnf update

DNF update including kernel during image customization makes
overcloud images unbootable.

[1] Skipped kernel update during repo setup but kernel
get's updated during setting up packages from gating repo.
This patch excludes kernel update here too to avoid this issue.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/856603

Related-Bug: #1987632
Change-Id: Ief8021702cfca3a3767299464f14a0ef6128eae0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras refs/changes/10/858010/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(ykarel) Exclude kernel update due to # https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1987632 {{ ansible_pkg_mgr }} --exclude=kernel* --enablerepo="gating-repo" update -y

'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-09-20 15:34:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/c30d2a1f6b5d0f5fbaa9b44299810b8bdd4c6da2', 'message': 'Move the "ovn_hash_ring" clean up to maintenance worker

is now executed on the ``HashRingHealthCheckPeriodics`` class, tha
is executed on the ``MaintenanceWorker`` process.

In a HA scenario, if several servers are rebooted at the same time,
the "ovn_hash_ring" clean up operation can clash with API worker
method "_load_hash_ring", that executed a SQL read from this table.
In some high loaded environments, if the OVN database takes time
to be locally cached, this read operation is executed thousand of
times; basically any time an OVN database event occurs.

In order to avoid/skip a deadlock when deleting the "ovn_hash_ring"
table, this clean up is executed in a periodic task. If this task
succeeds, the task is stopped. If the task raises a database
exception, it is processed again.

Now the "ovn_hash_ring" registers are retrieved using the
"created_at" time as a filter. The initial time is taken when the
OVN mechanism driver is initilized, before any API worker is spawned
and any new "ovn_hash_ring" register has been created (an API
worker, when started, will create a new "ovn_hash_ring" register).
Any stale/old register stored in this table will be ignored; that
means any register created before the OVN mechanism driver was
started.

Closes-Bug: #1990174

Change-Id: I07c4cb6e20b8a84e4ace7a8e34555aced5b5da9f

commit_message:
Move the "ovn_hash_ring" clean up to maintenance worker

The "ovn_hash_ring" procedure to clean up the stale/old registers
is now executed on the ``HashRingHealthCheckPeriodics`` class, tha
is executed on the ``MaintenanceWorker`` process.

In a HA scenario, if several servers are rebooted at the same time,
the "ovn_hash_ring" clean up operation can clash with API worker
method "_load_hash_ring", that executed a SQL read from this table.
In some high loaded environments, if the OVN database takes time
to be locally cached, this read operation is executed thousand of
times; basically any time an OVN database event occurs.

In order to avoid/skip a deadlock when deleting the "ovn_hash_ring"
table, this clean up is executed in a periodic task. If this task
succeeds, the task is stopped. If the task raises a database
exception, it is processed again.

Now the "ovn_hash_ring" registers are retrieved using the
"created_at" time as a filter. The initial time is taken when the
OVN mechanism driver is initilized, before any API worker is spawned
and any new "ovn_hash_ring" register has been created (an API
worker, when started, will create a new "ovn_hash_ring" register).
Any stale/old register stored in this table will be ignored; that
means any register created before the OVN mechanism driver was
started.

Closes-Bug: #1990174

Change-Id: I07c4cb6e20b8a84e4ace7a8e34555aced5b5da9f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/42/858542/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_db import exception as db_exc def __init__(self, group, created_time): self._created_time = created_time @periodics.periodic(spacing=ovn_const.HASH_RING_TOUCH_INTERVAL) def clean_up_hash_ring_nodes(self): try: hash_ring_db.remove_nodes_from_host( self.ctx, self._group, created_before=self._created_time) except db_exc.DBError as exc: LOG.info('The "ovn_hash_ring" table was not cleaned; the ' 'operation will be retried. Error: %s', str(exc)) return raise periodics.NeverAgain()

message from the hash ring.

commit_message:
[OVN] Rate limit the "Disallow caching" log from hash ring

This patch adds a condition prior to logging the "Disallow caching" log
message from the hash ring.

Prior to this patch, this message was logged when the number of nodes
connected to the hash ring was different from the number of API workers
at Neutron's startup. This is because the hash ring waits until all API
workers are connected to build the hash ring cache.

With this patch, we will only log the message once (per worker) until
the number of connected nodes changes. When nodes connect and the cache
is built the _wait_startup_before_caching() is no longer used until the
service is restarted again.

(cherry picked from Neutron 9655466763282f47a06862a47f7f31b48130277e)

Change-Id: I4f62b723083215483a2277cfcb798506671e1a2d
Closes-Bug: 1989480
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/35/858735/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Flag to rate limit the caching log self._prev_num_nodes = -1 num_nodes = len(nodes) if num_nodes >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", num_nodes, api_workers) # NOTE(lucasagomes): We only log when the number of connected # nodes are different to prevent this message from being spammed if self._prev_num_nodes != num_nodes: LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", num_nodes, api_workers) self._prev_num_nodes = num_nodes
deleted_lines: if len(nodes) >= api_workers: LOG.debug("Allow caching, nodes %s>=%s", len(nodes), api_workers) LOG.debug("Disallow caching, nodes %s<%s", len(nodes), api_workers)

commit_message:
Remove unused molecule Dockerfile.j2

This Dockerfile.j2 file is not used by molecule. Only the molecule
scenario directory is checked for the existence of the file specified
with the "dockerfile" key in the platforms YAML. If that file doesn't
exist, the default Dockerfile.j2 bundled with molecule is used.

Change-Id: Ib47c029955c1c800b672d964d1e15e05d2d0ae18
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

commit_message:
We need to downgrade in the pre.yml as well

There's an issue with containers-common not providing all the needed gpg
keys, leading to failures when the job downloads a container.

the directories.yml kicks in too early, so the package isn't installed
at that point, since it's installed as a dependency of podman, installed
during the "Run bindep" task,

Change-Id: I440615cc8fdeaf4a315dede080141528278aec94
Related-Bug: #1988514
(cherry picked from commit 4c6889ece5b66912ae240ae222c97d726711d52a)
